text: Tap @ at source. Pours hazy deep golden with a white head. Aroma of loads of fresh hops, quite spicey, light herbal, light lemon drops, loads of minerals, very clean nose. Taste is quite bitter from the others, loads of herbal hops in the taste, clean and refreshing!

My Bottom Line:
Mild caramel meets earthy, orangey hops and their green bitterness in this rustic Zoiglbier.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the misty amber.
-The mouthfeel on this one wasnt too carbonated compared to other Windischeschenbach and Neuhaus Zoiglbiers that weekend. I thought this softer bubbling actually worked better with the malty profile and made the beer a standout.
-The flavour profile is balanced.
-The quenching factor is quite high.

On tap at their zoiglstube.

On tap at the brewery tap Windischeschenbach. Hazy brown amber colour lasting beige head. hoppy aroma and maybe some specialists malt spicy hoppy finish. Entertaining dtinking it in the alley outside as the room was full

Draft ungespundetes pour during a private visit. All Hallertau Perle hops and Pilsner and Munich malt. Hazed amber gold with a short white head of large bubbles. Aroma is strongly sweaty and game-y with malty notes of caramel and pancakes with quieter notes of pepper-spice-spruce needle-evergreen, something I assume is a combination of hops, brewers yeast, and bacteria. Plus theres something like fennel or cardamom up in this wonky nose. Altogether an unpleasant aroma but unique and distinct from every other Zoigl Ive had from Windischeschenbach. Medium bodied, sweet with medium-low bitterness, low carbonation leaves it flabby and syrupy, but the burnt pancake batter maltiness is actually somewhat decent in the mouth, not as sweaty-gross as in the aroma. Pretty odd having it nearly flat but thats the intent with not adding CO2 to the tank. Still I have to score it as I taste and smell it, and this one is just plain undesirable, but I have mad respect for the brewer and his ways.

Draught(@ Da Roude, Eschawo):Golden, hazy, quite stable white head, sweetish grainy nose with a solid touch of vegetables, some yeast detectable; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied, a bit tart; short finish of sweet grainy malt , mixed with shy hops and some vegetables. Poor

UPDATED: APR 9, 2017 Tap @ Zum Roudn, Windischeschenbach. July 2013. Pours hazy dark orange with a small white head. Yeasty and phenolic nose and flavor. Grassy hops with fruit and yeast beneath. Quite dirty. 3,1
Tap @ Zum Roudn, April 2017.
Breadcrust, baguette, grass and slight twist of lemon hop. Another beer this time. Soft, minerally. Spicy hoppy .. Absolutely amazing! 4,3.
Cloudy dark golden with a lasting white head. Malty aroma with hintsof yeast and sulphur. Sweetish malty flavour with yeasty notes, herbal hops and a nice bitterness
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2013 Milder, dunkel getreidiger Antrunk. Heber werdend, aufkommende Hopfigkeit. Spritzig, die blumige Hopfigkeit wird intensiver. Würzig getreidiger Ausklang. 9/11/12/12//12

Draught @ Zum Roudn (Da Roude), Stadtplatz 3, Windischeschenbach, Bavaria Germany 92670.Unclear medium yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, toasted - caramel, light hoppy. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, caramel, fruity, citrus notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120406]

At Zum Roudn 11/07/2011. Hazy amber with a big, off-white head. Aroma of citrus fruit, some caramel and grassy hops. Flavour had some malty sweetness, marmalade and a long, bitter finish. Very enjoyable.

Tap at Zum Roudn.  Light apple and barley malt aroma.  Hazy orange-amber color with giant head.  Sweet fruity barley malt flavor - fruity flavor somewhere between apple and orange.  Nice grassy hops finish.  Seemed to stand out among the Zoigls I had - Excellent - didnt want to stop drinking this one.
Cloudy dull tan-amber.  Full but somewhat loose head.  Herbal aroma has perhaps a bit more dusty yeast than the White Swan Zoigl.  Has a pithy herbal dryness.  Lots of hop finish.

At Zum Roudn. Hazy orange brew with thick off-white foam. Served in a pewter-lidded glass stein, one of the only such mugs I have ever been served in. Aroma is mild with fresh fruity hop and sundried grain. Low carbonation. Soft and very easy to drink. Pretty thin in the finish after going through a citrusy and yeasty middle. Balanced and nice. Fresh big grain flavors. I also tasted something like toasted orange peel.

Draught at the tap. Good fruity aroma. Hazy bright orange colour. Stable white head. The flavour is mildly fruity. Low bitterness. Malty aftertaste. The finish is a bit watery and the mouthfeel slightly thin.
